title: Fleeing shoplifter runs across I-5, causes crashes near Lynnwood
content:
A fleeing shoplifting suspect ran across Interstate 5 near Lynnwood on Wednesday, causing several traffic accidents before he was arrested, according to the Snohomish County Sheriff’s Office. 
 
The suspect was confronted by a security guard after he was caught shoplifting around 9:30 a.m. at the Wal-Mart on 164th Street Southwest, just east of I-5. 
 
After a brief scuffle, the suspect ran west, jumped from an on-ramp onto I-5 and bolted across the north- and southbound lanes of the interstate, the sheriff’s office said. 
   
An off-duty police officer in the area apprehended the suspect, the sheriff’s office said. A deputy suffered minor injuries during the incident.
